template: {CHARACTER_0} had some stickers. After giving 15 to {CHARACTER_1} and receiving 8 from {CHARACTER_2}, {CHARACTER_0} now has 23 stickers. How many stickers did {CHARACTER_0} have at first?
{CHARACTER_0} and {CHARACTER_1} share marbles in ratio 3:5. After {CHARACTER_1} gives 6 marbles to {CHARACTER_0}, they have equal amounts. How many marbles did {CHARACTER_0} have at first?
{CHARACTER_0} spent 1/3 of money on lunch and 1/4 on snacks. If {CHARACTER_0} has $25 left, how much money did {CHARACTER_0} have at first?
{CHARACTER_0} scored 75% in a test. If {CHARACTER_0} got 5 more marks, the score would be 85%. How many questions were in the test?

{CHARACTER_0}, {CHARACTER_1}, and {CHARACTER_2} have 180 cards. {CHARACTER_0} has twice as many as {CHARACTER_1}, and {CHARACTER_2} has 20 more than {CHARACTER_1}. How many cards does {CHARACTER_0} have?
The average age of {CHARACTER_0}, {CHARACTER_1}, and {CHARACTER_2} is 12 years. If {CHARACTER_2} is 15 years old, what is the average age of {CHARACTER_0} and {CHARACTER_1}?
{CHARACTER_0} has coins in ratio of 2:3:5 for bronze, silver, and gold coins. If {CHARACTER_0} has 15 gold coins, how many coins does {CHARACTER_0} have in total?
{CHARACTER_0} and {CHARACTER_1} start 120m apart and walk towards each other. {CHARACTER_0} walks at 4m/s and {CHARACTER_1} at 6m/s. After how many seconds will they meet?
{CHARACTER_0} read 2/5 of a book on Monday and 1/3 of the remainder on Tuesday. If 24 pages are left, how many pages are in the book?
{CHARACTER_0} bought a game on sale at 20% discount for $64. What was the original price?
